pros: just like family, vacation, sick time, benefits
cons: low wages, can't compete with regular pay scales
Very strict schedules - my site was punch in and out with timecards even for salary employees.

review_title: Not enough staff for the work that needs to be done
pros: Some sites have incredible staff that really support and uplift one another. Decent insurance for full time employees only (not for casual employees)
cons:
They ask way too much from the employees for what we're getting paid.
CEO was fired which came as a big shock, new CEO is much less family oriented and only cares about the $$

review_title: Overall I wouldn't work here again
pros: It's really clear that the people who work here are genuinely committed to their work. There's room for advancement in some departments (HR, Accounting). Good pension
cons: Excessive workload, not enough resources, inconsistent (read: haphazard) decision making, no room for advancement.
Takes long to progress in career

job_title: Dining Room Attendant in Edmonton, AB
pros:
Ensure best management protocols 
Very well-organized
Supports easily made available for employees
Thorough training
cons: Heavily unionized, almost to the point where it disadvantages entree-level employees form moving up within the organization quickly. For example, as a casual worker, despite my volunteer and educational experience, a senior employee without that same volunteer experience and education would be next-up for the position. It appears as if they hire more so based on seniority and hours worked as opposed to merit.

pros: Nice and comfortable environment , staff friendly and aprochable the CEO sometimes help with the chores.
cons: slow salary increase and evaluation late actions inconsiderate among employees no frequent check on the chores by management one sided among staff when there's misunderstanding
